He was intrusted with a commission to levy     the fines imposed by the Privy Council for non-conformity, in the     district of Dumfries and Galloway. In this capacity he vexed the     country so much by his exactions, that the people rose and made him     prisoner, and then proceeded in arms towards Mid-Lothian, where they     were defeated at Pentland Hills, in 1666.
